newsitem.title: MEXICO: NAFTA panel backs Mexico anti-dumping measure.
newsitem.headline: NAFTA panel backs Mexico anti-dumping measure.

text.p: A U.S.-Mexican binational panel established under the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) has upheld a Mexican anti-dumping measure against U.S. flat recovered steel imports, the Mexican Trade Ministry (SECOFI) said on Sunday.

The panel, made up of three Mexican and two U.S. representatives, was investigating an August 1994 SECOFI resolution that imposed a 38.2 percent tariff on U.S. exporters with the exception of LTV Steel and Bethlehem Steel Corporation, SECOFI said.
At issue was whether SECOFI had the authority to investigate the dumping claim and impose the tariff to begin with.

"After a thorough analysis the panel unanimoualy concluded that the International Trade Practices Unit of SECOFI had the authority ... to investigate international unfair trade practices," the news release said.
